public.title: AI in EdTech - Roundtable Discussion
public.description: Join the Boston EdTech Foundation at Venture Cafe Kendall Square for a roundtable discussion on what is really happening with AI in EdTech. This is a small (<40 person), in-person event for senior leaders and experts in AI and education. It's a Chatham House rule discussion on what is really working and not working with AI in edtech. There's a lot of hype, everyone is now an AI-first company but I'm hoping we can get real and talk about what is really happening in our organizations.

topics.title: Strategy
topics.description: What is the future vision for life and work that we believe we are working toward? 2/5/10+ years out?

topics.title: Skills
topics.description: What skills are rising/falling in importance within our companies? What impact is AI having on this?
questions: How does this impact our sales & marketing?

topics.title: ROI
topics.description: How are we calculating ROI for our investment in AI?
questions: Is it driving revenue, lowering costs or simply a sunk cost to stay competitive?
Are customers/capital investing in us, new competitors, big players like MS or holding off on spend?
Are we able to separate geopolitics, economy and AI?

topics.title: AI Burnout
topics.description: What impact is the pace of AI innovation having on us and our teams? What are we doing about it?
questions: Are we trying to stay on top?
Are we fearful of job loss due to automation?

private.location: Santo Domingo Room, Cambridge Innovation Center, 1 Broadway, Cambridge, MA
